author: Special Correspondent
text:
Labour Commissioner-cum- Director of Employment and Training, E.Vallavan on Wednesday appealed to all the job-seekers to register their profiles on the National Career Service Portal.

The portal provides job matching services in a highly transparent and user friendly manner.

Portal launched in 2015

Mr. Vallavan pointed out that the Union Government has launched a national career service portal in July 2015 with a view to bridge the gap between those who need jobs and those who want to hire them, between people seeking career guidance and training and those who can provide necessary counselling and training.

The National Career Service aims at reaching out to youth across the country bringing job-seekers, employers, counsellors, trainers and placement organisations together on one platform, he said in a press release.

A national ICT based portal is developed primarily to connect the opportunities with the aspirations of youth. This portal facilitates registration of job seekers, job providers, skill providers, career counsellors. Regisration is online and free of charge.

The Labour Commissioner added all the job-seekers should register on the portal www.ncs.gov.in .

Toll free helpline

A multilingual toll free call centre helpline no- 1800-425-1514 will redress difficulties in registration or to answer queries. The call centre will be operational from Tuesday to Sunday 8 a.m to 8 p.m.

Portal bridges the gap between those who need jobs and those who want to hire them
title: Labour Commissioner asks job seekers to register on portal
